ygData.subject: Re: Armor for Wizards?
ygData.msgSnippet: 1. Your ac will go up with your level. I m 14th and with lesser shielding I ve got an ac in the 220 s (well, over 200 in any case) 2. If your spell is
ygData.messageBody:
1. Your ac will go up with your level. I'm 14th and with lesser shielding
I've got an ac in the 220's (well, over 200 in any case)
2. If your spell is interrupted keep clicking. You don't lose mana if you're
interrupted.
3. Make damned sure that you're not set on attack when you wanna do this.
4. Always take a step or 2 backwards. Sometime the beast is just attacking
you because you laced into it with more than the combined damage of your
barbarian friends combined. Most times they'll turn back on someone else.
Unless they're REALLY pissed, in that case go for roots cuz' if you haven't
taken it out by now and it's attacking you, you're probably dead. : )
(happens to me all the time, annoying but understandable when after 2 shocks
of lightning they've eaten 160 pts of damage)

Zalbar
14th Wizard
Solusek Ro

-----Original Message-----
From: jcross@... <jcross@...>
To: eq_wizards@onelist.com <eq_wizards@onelist.com>
Date: 17 avril, 1999 10:18
Subject: [eq_wizards] Armor for Wizards?


>From: jcross@...
>
>I'm sure many of us have the same problem... cloth armor. Sure, it's fine
for level 1-4 where that's all anyone has, but as I get up past level 10 I'm
finding it really lacking.
>
>I don't expect to be a tank like the other classes, but it would be nice if
monsters missed enough that when they turn on me in our party, I have a
chance of getting a root spell off because they miss, y'know?
>
>So my question is simple: has anyone found any armor anywhere for wizards
that is better than normal Cloth? I'm looking for stuff that can be worn by
a High Elf, but I'm sure there are other classes around that are interested
as well...
>If you know of anything, what kind of armor is it, where do you get it,
what do you have to do, and what kind of protection does it provide?
>
>Anyone know any other good tricks to improving armor class for wizards?
(magic items, special earrings or rings, whatever?)
>
>------------------------------------------------------------------------
>Did you know that knowledge is power?

>
